text: Ban Lat (, ) is a district (amphoe) in the central part of Phetchaburi Province, western Thailand. ==Geography== Neighboring districts are (from the north clockwise) Khao Yoi, Mueang Phetchaburi, Tha Yang, Kaeng Krachan, and Nong Ya Plong of Phetchaburi Province. ==History== Originally named Tha Chang (ท่าช้าง), it was renamed Ban Lat in 1939. ==Economy== The production of palm sugar (; ) is a specialty of the district. ==Administration== The district is divided into 18 sub-districts (tambons), which are further subdivided into 115 villages (mubans). Ban Lat is a sub-district municipality (thesaban tambon) and covers tambon Ban Lat. There are a further 14 tambon administrative organizations (TAO). {| ! No. ! Name ! Thai !
